member.name: T:OIV.Inventor.SbLine
member.summary:
Directed line in 3D.
Represents a directed line in 3D. This is a basic Open Inventor datatype that is used for representing a 3D line. It is used as input and output by a variety of Open Inventor classes.

member.name: M:OIV.Inventor.SbLine.#ctor(OIV.Inventor.SbVec3f,OIV.Inventor.SbVec3f)
member.summary: Constructor. To struct a line from a position and direction, use SbLine(p0, p0 + dir). The line is directed from to .

member.overloads: Sets line using a position and a direction vector.
member.summary: Sets line using a position and a direction vector.
member.remarks: The direction vector will be normalized automatically. This method is preferred over setValue when the point has very large magnitude, for example 1e6, because adding a normalized direction vector to such a point may not be significant.

member.returns: Returns false if the lines are parallel (results undefined), and returns true otherwise.

member.name: P:OIV.Inventor.Generic.SbNativeArray`1.DataPointer
member.summary: Pointer to the underlying native array.

remarks.para: The returned pointer can be used in an unsafe code block to iterate thought the elements.
As read/write operation may occur in an unsafe block, no check will be performed to know if the buffer supports read/write access.

member.summary: Flags which indicates if pointer to data is own by current object or not.

member.summary: Size in bytes of the buffer

member.summary: Capacity in bytes of the buffer.

member.name: P:OIV.Inventor.Generic.SbNativeArray`1.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets or sets the element at the specified index.

remarks.para: If you iterates thought a significant number of elements using this indexer, you may encounter performance issue if the underlying buffer is not a managed buffer (CanGetBuffer returns false).
For better performances, you can consider using the DataPointer property combined with unsafe code to access/modify the underlying native buffer.

member.param: The zero-based index of the element to get or set.
member.returns: The element of type at the specified index.
member.exception: If the native array is not well known.

member.name: T:OIV.Inventor.SbViewportRegion
member.summary:
Class for representing a viewport.
This class represents the active viewport region in a display window. It contains the screen-space size of the window as well as the origin and size of the viewport within the window. By default, the viewport is the same as the full window. Methods allow the viewport to be set either in terms of screen-space pixels or as normalized coordinates, where (0,0) is the lower-left corner of the window and (1,1) is the upper-right corner.

member.name: F:OIV.Inventor.SbViewportRegion.Default
member.summary: Provide a default viewport region equivalent to new SbViewportRegion(100,100,1) Note to developper who comes from C++. As .NET framework does not allow to define a parameterless constructor for struct, use this field to keep the same behavior. When you write SbViewportRegion viewport = new SbViewportRegion() > all internal fields are zeroed. Writing SbViewportRegion viewport = SbViewportRegion.Default ensures you to have an equivalent object.

member.name: T:OIV.Inventor.SbTrackerInfo
member.summary: Class for representing 3D tracker information.

remarks.para: An object that stores information about the state of a 3D tracker device, specifically position and orientation.

A "tracker" is any device whose position and orientation are dynamically tracked in 3D, typically for immersive VR applications. For example: a head tracker. A "controller" is an input device which typically has buttons and/or valuators (e.g. a joystick). Many controllers have an associated tracker. For example, the commonly used "wand" input device has three buttons, a two-axis joystick (two valuators), and an associated tracker.

The virtual method can be used to determine if an event object has associated tracker information. Traditional 2D events like and return . 3D events like and return their associated tracker information (SbTrackerInfo).

In addition to the usual methods for setting an orientation, this class provides a method that takes three Euler angles specified in radians. This allows orientation information returned by the widely used trackd API to be stored directly into an Open Inventor event object.

Tracker info is most often used by Open Inventor classes to specify a direction for picking or intersection with a dragger. This class provides the method to conveniently get an defining the direction the tracker is pointing.

member.name: M:OIV.Inventor.SbBox3s.Outside(OIV.Inventor.SbMatrix@,System.Int32@)
member.overloads: Tests if bounding box is completely outside the view-volume defined by the model+view+projection matrix given.
member.summary: Tests if bounding box is completely outside the view-volume defined by the model+view+projection matrix given.

remarks.para: keeps track of which view-volume clipping planes the box is completely inside of; if a 'parent' bounding box of this bounding box was found to be completely inside the left/right clipping planes, the low bit of cullBits will be set to zero, and this routine will not test this box against those planes.
When cullBits is zero, it is a waste of time to call this function! Before calling this the first time, set cullBits to 7 ( and will handle this automatically for render culling).

member.param: Keeps track of which view-volume clipping planes the box is completely inside of. Set to 7 when calling this method for the first time.
member.returns: true if this box is completely outside, false otherwise.

member.summary: Finds the span of a box along a specified .
member.remarks: The span is the total distance the box occupies along a given direction. The total distance is returned in the form of a minimum and maximum distance from the origin of each of the corners of the box along the given direction. The difference between these two values is the span.

member.name: M:OIV.Inventor.SbBox3d.Outside(OIV.Inventor.SbMatrixd@,System.Int32@)
member.overloads: Tests if bounding box is completely outside the view-volume defined by the model+view+projection matrix given.
member.summary: Tests if bounding box is completely outside the view-volume defined by the model+view+projection matrix given.

remarks.para: keeps track of which view-volume clipping planes the box is completely inside of; if a 'parent' bounding box of this bounding box was found to be completely inside the left/right clipping planes, the low bit of cullBits will be set to zero, and this routine will not test this box against those planes.
When cullBits is zero, it is a waste of time to call this function! Before calling this the first time, set cullBits to 7 ( and will handle this automatically for render culling).

member.param: Keeps track of which view-volume clipping planes the box is completely inside of. Set to 7 when calling this method for the first time.
member.returns: true if this box is completely outside, false otherwise.

member.name: M:OIV.Inventor.SbBox3d.GetSpan(OIV.Inventor.SbVec3d,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Finds the span of a box along a specified .
member.remarks: The span is the total distance the box occupies along a given direction. The total distance is returned in the form of a minimum and maximum distance from the origin of each of the corners of the box along the given direction. The difference between these two values is the span.

member.name: T:OIV.Inventor.SbXfBox3f
member.summary: 3D box with an associated transformation matrix.
member.remarks: This class is useful when a box will be transformed frequently; if an is used for this purpose it will expand each time it is transformed in order to keep itself axis-aligned. Transformations can be accumulated on an SbXfBox3f without expanding the box, and after all transformations have been done, the box can be expanded to an axis-aligned box if necessary.

member.name: M:OIV.Inventor.SbXfBox3f.GetSpan(OIV.Inventor.SbVec3f,System.Single@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Finds the span of a box along a specified .
member.remarks: The span is the total distance the box occupies along a given direction. The total distance is returned in the form of a minimum and maximum distance from the origin of each of the corners of the box along the given direction. The difference between these two values is the span.

member.name: T:OIV.Inventor.SbXfBox3d
member.summary: 3D box with an associated transformation matrix.
member.remarks: A 3D box with an arbitrary transformation applied. This class is useful when a box will be transformed frequently; if an SbBox3f is used for this purpose it will expand each time it is transformed in order to keep itself axis-aligned. Transformations can be accumulated on an without expanding the box, and after all transformations have been done, the box can be expanded to an axis-aligned box if necessary

member.name: T:OIV.Inventor.SbMatrixd
member.summary:
4x4 matrix class (double precision).
4x4 double precision matrix class/datatype. Although Open Inventor fields still store only single precision values, for certain applications it is useful and convenient to be able to store and manipulate double precision values, for example, double precision coordinate data or values that will be used for further computation.
The matrices are stored in row-major order.

member.name: T:OIV.Inventor.SbSphere
member.summary:
Class for representing a sphere.
Represents a sphere in 3D. This is a lightweight datatype that is used for arguments or return values in the Open Inventor toolkit. See for a database sphere (used for rendering, picking, etc.).

member.name: M:OIV.Inventor.SbColor.SetPackedValue(System.UInt32,System.Single@)
member.summary: Sets value of color vector from an RGBA packed color value.
member.remarks:
The packed color format expressed in hexadecimal is 0xrrggbbaa, where
rr is the red value
gg is the green value
bb is the blue value
aa is the alpha value
RGBA component values range from 0 to 0xFF (255). The returned transparency value is a floating point value between 0.0 (opaque) and 1.0 (completely transparent). It is derived from the alpha component of the RGBA color.

member.name: M:OIV.Inventor.SbColor.GetPackedValue
member.summary: Returns an RGBA packed color value, derived from the color vector and the passed transparency value.
member.remarks: The alpha component is set to (1.0 - transparency) * 255, resulting in a hex value between 0 and 0xFF. If transparency not specified, alpha is set to 0xFF (opaque).

member.name: M:OIV.Inventor.SbColor.GetPackedValue(System.Single)
member.summary: Returns an RGBA packed color value, derived from the color vector and the passed transparency value.
member.remarks: The alpha component is set to (1.0 - transparency) * 255, resulting in a hex value between 0 and 0xFF. If transparency not specified, alpha is set to 0xFF (opaque).

member.name: T:OIV.Inventor.SbElapsedTime
member.summary:
Class for measuring elapsed time with high resolution.
This measures elapsed time in seconds. It uses the highest resolution timer available on the system, to allow measuring very short intervals. There is no guarantee the timer resolution will be better than SbTime (which is used if no better method is available).

member.name: T:OIV.Inventor.SbRotation

member.remarks: Rotations are stored internally as quaternions.

member.name: T:OIV.Inventor.SbRotationd
member.summary:
Class for representing a rotation (double precision).
Object that stores a rotation using double precision values. Although Open Inventor fields still store only single precision values, for certain applications it is useful and convenient to be able to store and manipulate double precision values, for example, double precision coordinate data or values that will be used for further computation.
There are several ways to specify a rotation: quaternion (4 doubles, in the order x, y, z, w), 4x4 rotation matrix, or axis and angle. All angles are in radians and all rotations are right-handed.
member.remarks: Rotations are stored internally as quaternions.

2D vector class (double precision).

member.name: T:OIV.Inventor.SbVec3d
member.summary:
3D vector class (double precision).
3D vector class used to store 3D vectors and points. Although Open Inventor fields still store only single precision values, for certain applications it is useful and convenient to be able to store and manipulate double precision values, for example, double precision coordinate data or values that will be used for further computation.

member.name: T:OIV.Inventor.SbVec4d
member.summary:
4D vector class (double precision).
4D vector class used to store homogeneous coordinates. Although Open Inventor fields still store only single precision values, for certain applications it is useful and convenient to be able to store and manipulate double precision values, for example, double precision coordinate data or values that will be used for further computation

member.name: T:OIV.Inventor.SbViewVolume
member.summary:
3D viewing volume class.
Class used to represent a 3D viewing volume. This class is used to represent viewing frusta and picking volumes. For perspective projection, the view volume is a frustum. For orthographic (parallel) projection, the view volume is a rectangular prism.

member.name: M:OIV.Inventor.SbViewVolume.GetMatrices(OIV.Inventor.SbMatrix@,OIV.Inventor.SbMatrix@)
member.summary: Returns two matrices corresponding to the view volume.
member.remarks: The first is a viewing matrix, which is guaranteed to be an affine transformation. The second is suitable for use as a projection matrix in OpenGL. The return value is the stereo offset for a camera.

member.name: M:OIV.Inventor.SbViewVolume.GetMatrix
member.summary: Like the method , but returns the affine and projection parts together in one matrix (i.e., affine.MultRight(proj) ).

member.name: M:OIV.Inventor.SbViewVolume.GetCameraSpaceMatrix
member.summary: Returns a matrix that transforms the view volume into camera space: it translates the view volume so the viewpoint is at the origin, and rotates it so the view direction is along the negative z axis.

member.name: M:OIV.Inventor.SbViewVolume.ProjectPointToLine(OIV.Inventor.SbVec2f@,OIV.Inventor.SbLine@)
member.overloads: Maps a 2D point (in 0 <= x,y <= 1) to a 3D line.
member.summary: Maps a 2D point (in 0 <= x,y <= 1) to a 3D line.
member.param: Output parameter to store the line value.

member.name: M:OIV.Inventor.SbViewVolume.ProjectPointToLine(OIV.Inventor.SbVec2f,OIV.Inventor.SbLine@)
member.summary: Maps a 2D point (in 0 <= x,y <= 1) to a 3D line.
member.param: Output parameter to store the line value.

member.overloads: Maps a 2D point (in 0 <= x,y <= 1) to a 3D line.
member.summary: Maps a 2D point (in 0 <= x,y <= 1) to a 3D line.
member.param: Output parameter. Store one point which belong to the line.
Output parameter. Store one point which belong to the line.

member.name: M:OIV.Inventor.SbViewVolume.ProjectPointToLine(OIV.Inventor.SbVec2f,OIV.Inventor.SbVec3f@,OIV.Inventor.SbVec3f@)
member.summary: Maps a 2D point (in 0 <= x,y <= 1) to a 3D line.
member.param: Output parameter. Store one point which belong to the line.
Output parameter. Store one point which belong to the line.

member.name: M:OIV.Inventor.SbViewVolume.ProjectToScreen(OIV.Inventor.SbVec3f)
member.overloads: Maps the 3D point in world coordinates to a 2D point in normalized screen coordinates.
member.summary: Maps the 3D point in world coordinates to a 2D point in normalized screen coordinates (0 <= x,y,z <= 1). The z-screen coordinate represents the homogeneous z coordinate which goes (nonlinearly) from 0 at the near clipping plane to 1 at the far clipping plane.
member.param: Point to project in world coordinates.
member.returns: Projected point onto the near plane.

member.name: M:OIV.Inventor.SbViewVolume.ProjectToScreen(OIV.Inventor.SbVec3f,OIV.Inventor.SbVec3f@)
member.summary: Maps the 3D point in world coordinates to a 2D point in normalized screen coordinates (0 <= x,y,z <= 1). The z-screen coordinate represents the homogeneous z coordinate which goes (nonlinearly) from 0 at the near clipping plane to 1 at the far clipping plane.
member.param: Point to project in world coordinates.
Output parameter to store the result.

member.name: M:OIV.Inventor.SbViewVolume.ProjectToScreen(OIV.Inventor.SbVec3f@,OIV.Inventor.SbVec3f@)
member.summary: Maps the 3D point in world coordinates to a 2D point in normalized screen coordinates (0 <= x,y,z <= 1). The z-screen coordinate represents the homogeneous z coordinate which goes (nonlinearly) from 0 at the near clipping plane to 1 at the far clipping plane.
member.param: Point to project in world coordinates.
Output parameter to store the result.

member.name: M:OIV.Inventor.SbViewVolume.ProjectFromScreen(OIV.Inventor.SbVec3f)
member.overloads: Maps a 3D point in normalized screen coordinates (0 <= x,y,z <= 1) to a 3D world point.
member.summary: Maps a 3D point in normalized screen coordinates (0 <= x,y,z <= 1) to a 3D world point.
member.remarks: See for more details.
member.param: Input point in normalized screen coordinates.

member.name: M:OIV.Inventor.SbViewVolume.ProjectFromScreen(OIV.Inventor.SbVec3f@,OIV.Inventor.SbVec3f@)
member.summary: Maps a 3D point in normalized screen coordinates (0 <= x,y,z <= 1) to a 3D world point.

remarks.para: The resulting Z coordinate represents the normalized distance at which the point would be back projected, ranging from 0 at the near clipping plane to 1 at the far clipping plane. This method is simply the inverse of . See also .

Note: This is a convenience function that calls the method and apply on it, then transforms the point. The and calls are somewhat expensive, so if you need to project a large number of points you should call these methods just once and apply the matrix to each point using .

member.param: Input point in normalized screen coordinates.

member.name: M:OIV.Inventor.SbViewVolume.GetPlane(System.Single)
member.summary: Returns a plane parallel to the near (or far) plane of the view volume at a given distance from the projection point (eye).
member.param: Distance from eye of requested plane.

member.name: M:OIV.Inventor.SbViewVolume.GetSightPoint(System.Single)
member.summary: Returns the point along the line of sight at the given distance from the projection point (eye).
member.param: Distance from eye of requested point.

member.name: M:OIV.Inventor.SbViewVolume.Narrow(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Narrows the view to the given sub-rectangle.
member.remarks: Given a view volume, narrows the view to the given sub-rectangle of the near plane. The coordinates of the rectangle are between 0 and 1, where (0,0) is the lower-left corner of the near plane and (1,1) is the upper-right corner.

member.overloads: Narrows a view volume by the given box.
member.summary: Narrows a view volume by the given box.
member.remarks: The box must lie inside the unit cube, and the view will be shrunk according to the size of the box.
member.param: Box used to narrow the volume.

member.name: M:OIV.Inventor.SbViewVolume.Ortho(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets up an orthographic view volume with the given sides.
member.remarks: The parameters are the same as for the OpenGL glOrtho() routine.
member.param: The coordinate for the left-vertical clipping plane.
The coordinates for the right-vertical clipping plane.
The coordinate for the bottom-horizontal clipping plane.
The coordinate for the top-horizontal clipping plane.
The coordinate of the near clipping plane. The coordinate is negative if the plane is behind the viewer.
The coordinate of the far clipping plane. The coordinate is negative if the plane is behind the viewer.

member.name: M:OIV.Inventor.SbViewVolume.Perspective(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets up a perspective view volume with the given field of view and aspect ratio.
member.remarks: The parameters are the same as for the OpenGL gluPerspective() routine, except that the field is specified in radians.
member.param: The field of view angle, in radians, in the y-direction.
The aspect ratio that determines the field of view in the x-direction. The aspect ratio is the ratio of x (width) to y (height).
The distance from the viewer to the near clipping plane (always positive).
The distance from the viewer to the far clipping plane (always positive).

member.name: M:OIV.Inventor.SbViewVolume.Frustum(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Alternate way to Set up a perspective view volume.
member.remarks: The parameters are the same as for glFrustum, which allows an asymmetric view frustum. This is specifically useful for transferring the definition of a view volume from another package.

member.summary: Computes a narrowed view volume.
member.remarks: Computes a narrowed view volume which contains as tightly as possible the given interval on the z axis (in eye space). The returned view volume will never be larger than the current volume, however. and are given in terms of : this means that > must hold.
